subject: Re: [junit] writing MultiThreaded test cases using Junit

messageBody:
schennamaraja wrote:
>
> Hi!
> I need to write a test case where I need to spun off different
> threads to test one of my classes to test the thread safety of that
> class. I was wondering how do I do that using junit.

Alternatively to JPerf you could use the library provided in
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/junit/files/src/threadedtesting.jar
which includes an example to uncover a synchronization problem.

However, my current impression - after experimenting with multi-threaded
UTs - is that instead of coming up with obscure tests to detect
synchronization problems, read one of the books on Java threading and
synchronisation and use the patterns and libraries which are described
therein. The benefit is much greater. You can never be sure that your
tests can uncover all or even a siginificant part of all possible
concurrency bugs.

Johannes
